page.title: 01D-Block 06240300 Introduced
page.content: This D-Block is a flat rural area 5 miles S.W.of Norwich,consisting of 2 villages joined together,Framingham Earl and Poringland,and a 3rd adjacent Upper Stoke,intersected by the B1332 to Bungay and cross roads.The rest of the area is largely farmland. POPULATION AND UMEMPLOYMENT. The population of Framingham Earl in 1972 was 522.In 1981 the population decreased to 499.Using these figures 7% live in council areas.Poringland had in 1981 a population 2,735 major development is providing expansion.5% are unemployed 24% live in council areas.The villages are used as a suburb for Norwich but cut off by land owned by a large company - 'Colmans of Norwich'.
